p.s: after we have recently finished reading the book THUG, which deals with the topic of racism and police brutality in the USA in our English class, I started wondering whetehr racism is really such a topical problem in the US.
After doing some research online I stumbled upon this one German news article on zeit.de from August 2014 that sparked my interest.
I was shocked and surprised reading that text written by Alexandra Endres because apparently there are still many problems in America that black people are facing on a daily basis.
She explained that black men are more likely to be arrested by the police than white men, since black people are stopped and frisked more often than white people.
The article also mentioned that there was even a case two week ago, where a police officer shot an 18-year old18-year-old man which really shocked me.
Furthermore Alexandra Endres stated that black people have major economic and social problems in comparison to white people.
Black people in the USA are less likely to finish school, get a good diploma or even get a job at all.
One fourth of the black American population has to live in poverty while not even a tenth of the white population has to live under these circumstances!
Are thingy still that bad for black people in the USA?
I mean the article is a couple of years old, so did something change about that?
Did you witness any racism againsagainst black people yourself already and what can your black friends say about their experiences?
